ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Specify other event
If you marked more than one traumatic event in Part], put a checkmark in the box below next to the event that bothers you the most
Notes: 1=Serious accident, fire or explosion; 2=Natural disaster; 3=Non-sexual event by a family member or someone you know; 4=Non-sexual assault by a stranger; 5=Sexual assault by a family member or someone you know; 6=Sexual assault by a stranger; 7=Military combat or war zone; 8=Sexual contact when you were younger than 18 with someone who was 5 or more years older than you; 9=lmprisomnent; 10=Torture; 11=Life-threatening illness; 12=Other traumatic event

ElementDescription: the event that bothers you the most. How long ago did the event happen
Notes: 1=Less than one month; 2=1 to 3 months; 3= 3 to 6 months; 4 =6 months to 3 years; 5= 3 to 5 years; 6= More than 5 years

ElementDescription: the event that bothers you the most. Were you physically injured
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: the event that bothers you the most. Was someone else physically injured
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: the event that bothers you the most. Did you feel helpless
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: the event that bothers you the most. Did you feel terrified
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: how often that problem bothered you in the past month. Having upsetting thoughts or images about the event that came into your head when you didn't want them to
Notes: 0 =Not at all or only one time; 1= Once a week or less/once in a while; 2=2 to 4 times a week/half the time; 3= 5 or more times a week/almost always

ElementDescription: how often that problem bothered you in the past month. Having bad dreams or nightmares about the event
Notes: 0 =Not at all or only one time; 1= Once a week or less/once in a while; 2=2 to 4 times a week/half the time; 3= 5 or more times a week/almost always

ElementDescription: how often that problem bothered you in the past month. Reliving the event, acting or feeling as if it was happening again
Notes: 0 =Not at all or only one time; 1= Once a week or less/once in a while; 2=2 to 4 times a week/half the time; 3= 5 or more times a week/almost always

ElementDescription: how often that problem bothered you in the past month. Feeling emotionally upset when you were reminded of the event (for example, feeling scared, angry, sad, guilty etc.)
Notes: 0 =Not at all or only one time; 1= Once a week or less/once in a while; 2=2 to 4 times a week/half the time; 3= 5 or more times a week/almost always

ElementDescription: how often that problem bothered you in the past month. Experiencing physical reactions when you were reminded of the event (for example, breaking out in a sweat, heart beating fast)
